Line 217: Line 217:
New rules for the car eliminate the asymmetrical bodies on cars which had run rampant since the 1998 Taurus release. However, almost all advantages of using one car over another have been nullified. NASCAR requires all CoTs to conform to common body [[Template (racing)|templates]], regardless of make and model.
New rules for the car eliminate the asymmetrical bodies on cars which had run rampant since the 1998 Taurus release. However, almost all advantages of using one car over another have been nullified. NASCAR requires all CoTs to conform to common body [[Template (racing)|templates]], regardless of make and model.
â
The wing remained a controversial feature for several years. Its appearance was often criticized and was accused of forcing cars to become airborne in high-speed spins (however these accusations are based on [[anecdotal evidence]]). In 2010 NASCAR decided to replace the wing with a spoiler. The switch began with the [[2010 Goody's Fast Pain Relief 500]] at [[Martinsville Speedway]]<ref>[http://sports.espn.go.com/rpm/nascar/cup/news/story?id=5022117 espn.com] "Drivers take spoiler for spin at Charlotte" Retrieved 3/26/10</ref>
+
The wing remained a controversial feature for several years. Its appearance was often criticized and was accused of forcing cars to become airborne in high-speed spins (however these accusations are based on [[anecdotal evidence]]). In 2010 NASCAR decided to replace the wing with a spoiler. The switch began with the [[2010 Goody's Fast Pain Relief 500]] at [[Martinsville Speedway]].<ref>[http://sports.espn.go.com/rpm/nascar/cup/news/story?id=5022117 espn.com] "Drivers take spoiler for spin at Charlotte" Retrieved 3/26/10</ref>
â   â
In 2011 nascar will once again redesign the car with a lower nose and cover the splitter braces on the front of the car.
